page.title: 13RECENT GROWTH OF WOODINGDEAN
page.content: Woodingdean has only been developed recently.In 1953 there were still parts without roads,pavements or street lights.On the main road where there are now shops, there were prefabricated houses and an old farm building.There were few shops nearby.The present supermarket was a small temporary building. The surrounding land was farmed.Breeding pigs was common then, where as today arable farming is the major feature. The housing was private,the council estate had not been built.In the 1930's there was no main water supplied and water was delivered by donkey cart. The oldest building is an industrial school which was an extensian of the workhouse in Brighton and used to train poor children for jobs.It is now a Catholic Middle School.
